answers.answer: i would call your doc. it may not be pregnancy related

I would let your doc know in the morning. But heart racing at times is normal, the further you get in your pregnancy, the more blood you are pumping. That's why the doctor checks your BP every prenatal to make sure your BP stays within normal level. You could've been having an anxiety attack, which is also normal but your doctor needs to know just in case they want to prescribe anything. Anxiety attacks can cause migraines and racing heart.
Definitely let your doctor know. You could have preeclampsia.

You don't get preeclampsia at 13 weeks so you can rule that out. I had that happen to me while pregnant. It happened when I ate sugar. My heart would race like crazy. I told my midwife and she had never heard of it. No one had ever heard of it. Well I was ok but I ended up being induced at 37+6 for high blood pressure. My baby was fine the whole time and is perfectly healthy.
My head felt much better this morning, I have an appt on the 27th do you think I should still call my doc?

question: This is my second pregnancy and I never had this problem with my son. About five hours ago I tried to take a nap when I layed down my heart started racing. I got up an checked it was 104 bpm (normal is 60-80). My head started to hurt after that, its been getting worse an worse and I'd now to a migraine. I took tylenol an am laying down with a cold rag on my head my heart feels like its racing again. I'm 13w 3d, is this normal or should I call my doc in the morning?
title: Normal?
